headline: 'Gutfeld!' on media praising Biden's regime-change speech
subHeadline: Guests: Martha MacCallum, Larry Kudlow, Timpf, Tyrus

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, hello there. Great to see you again. Hope you had a great weekend. I know I did. Although the last thing I remember was Larry Kudlow putting on the leather mask. But I remember my childhood when I was a kid, I had a dog named Chipper. It was a miniature schnauzer that looked like a tiny German General with mange. No, think Wolf Blitzer, but with a color. The dog drove me crazy because we lived on a street between a park and a busy street full of fast cars. And whenever the dog got out, you think it would run to the park to pee or poop, you know, like vagrants and Democrat run cities. But no, it always ran up the street towards the traffic. And as kids would have to race after him and risk our lives trying to scoop the mutt out of harm's way was a weird habit. When offered options to pick the worst one, which seems to be a president's problem. Instead of taking a quiet walk to the park, he just loves to run right into traffic and scream World War III.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STTAES
utterances.sentences: We will have a different future, a brighter future, rooted in democracy in principle. Hope in light of decency and dignity and freedom and possibilities. For God's sake, this man cannot remain power.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, hejust said, for God's sake, this man cannot remain in power. And sadly, he wasn't talking about himself. He literally brought up regime change, pushing the war into a new phase where our president just validated exactly what Putin was thinking. He may as well have said, we're nuking Russia next week, unless they do it first. Thanks, Joe. As we inch closer to negotiations, we just took a giant step back. It's like being on the one-yard line and you get a 10-yard penalty for holding. That's baseball, Kat.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now I thought our policy wasn't to topple Putin. For us toppling regimes has worked out about as well as dating a stripper. At least for the people I dated when I was stripping. Biden threw gas on the fire and it's six bucks a gallon. That's really wasteful. If only someone had warned him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think the one thing he's got to say, this is where my expertise comes in. Stick to one essential truth. The invasion was a clear violation of international law. And don't bring up regime change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Who got Brad Pitt to be on "THE FIVE"? Oh, that was me. They should change the name of the show to The10, am I right? Because that's what I am. Right, Martha?

utterances.speaker: MARTHA MACCALLUM, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. I thought that was Brad Pitt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know. I get that a lot. I look younger. But maybe that's a question only the pope can answer. The funny part, watching the media proclaim how forceful Joe had been in his regime change talk only to watch it get walked back like an escaped prisoner being returned to his cell.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: What a powerful speech that we just heard from President Biden there.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The speech was really, really well done and it touched on several strategic points.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That line there at the end directly to Putin, I think is the standout line from that entire speech, Wolf.

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes. He made it clear, he wants Putin gone.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Certainly critical, certainly the message that he wanted to deliver here tonight. But that call at the end in terms of President Putin, that was something, no question about it.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: Obviously, those words this man cannot remain in power. Very, verystrong words.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. So strong. In fact, it had to be erased in a panic. A Biden aide said the president's point was that Putin cannot be allowed to exercise power over his neighbors on the region. He was not discussing Putin's power in Russia or regime change. Sorry. So (INAUDIBLE) forgot to say all of that. Now, it's bad enough, this administration is telling us what we can and can't say. Now they're telling us what we did and we didn't hear. Here's Joe trying to walk back his own words.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I want to make it clear, I wasn't then nor am I now, particularly the policy change. I was expressing more outrage that I feel I make no apologies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. But that came after something else. He said that was kind of pointless.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: You're in the midst of a fight between democracies and oligarchs? Who's going to prevail? Or democracy is going to prevail on a -- and the values we share? Or autocracies going to prevail? And that's really what's at stake. So, what you're doing is consequential, really consequential.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. How does this matter to the rest of the world? It only matters to us and it doesn't shorten the war. I'd only suggest that the war has a bigger mission for us, like it means more to us than it does to them. But does it? If only someone had warned him about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The invasion was a clear violation of international law. Don't start talking about protecting liberal democracies because places like China and Russia, they don't draw that line. It's not that important to them.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But they do understand violation of international law. You can't get around that statement.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who is that sexy beast? Someone should give that guy a late night show. But there were other gaffes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sir, deterrence didn't work. What makes you think Vladimir Putin will alter course, based on the action you've taken today?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Let's get something straight. Do you remember if you covered me from the very beginning, I did not say that, in fact, the sanctions would deter him? Sanctions never deter. You keep talking about that. Sanctions never deter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, then what's their point? Are sanctions, like aroma therapy, where we just pretended works, but it just stinks up the place. And then there's this.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Ukrainian people have a lot of backbone, people have a lot of guts. And I'm sure you're observing it. And I don't mean just a military. And you're going to see when you're there. And you -- some of you have been there. You're going to see -- you're going to see women, young people standing the middle of -- in front of a damn tankjust saying, I'm not leaving. I'm holding my ground.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, you're going to see me, you're going to see when you're there. Biden puts his foot in his mouth more than a marooned cannibal. Now, maybe no one takes what Joe says seriously, maybe the world leaders see our president like Forrest Gump. They laugh and take advantage of them. But this old dog leaves so many messes on the carpet. If only there was a product that could take care of that once and for all.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I am so sick of cleaning up these messes. There's got to be a better way.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, then we've got a scoop for you. Introducing the White House pooper-scooper for when the president makes a mess of things. Perfect for when your boss is talking (BLEEP)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: For god's sake this man cannot remain power.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Or engaged in pissing contests.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: To clarify on chemical weapons, could if chemical weapons were used in Ukraine, would that trigger a military response from NATO?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: It would trigger response in kind.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It even works on verbal diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: Talking about the significance of the passage of time. Right? The significance of the passage of time. So, when you think about it, there is great significance to the passage of time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Eighty-one million people can't be wrong. Order yours today. Shipping may take 12 to 14 months due to supply chain issues.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Wearing mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, the White House saw this trip to Brussels as a way to boost the precedence sagging numbers. So, you had all these photo ops eating pizza with troops, holding a refugee child, thank God there was no hair sniffing. And meeting with other so-called world leaders. But really if you wanted to enhance his status, he's just should have stayed home and dated Pete Davidson. It's sad, Joe's been in politics for over five decades, six if you count his first year as president. He was a V.P. for eight, been to a lot of countries, met all the players and of course knows Ukraine, like the back of Hunter's laptop. But in politics the longer you're in it the dumber and more detached you become. It's the only profession where experience counts against you. And the higher the stakes the more Biden screws up. Look, we know Putin violated international law and follows it with bomb and the crap out of Ukraine. So why help him at home by indulging his fears? It's just like telling Jesse Watters he's losing his hair. It only makes him angrier.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. In the interest of time, her bio list of people she hasn't interviewed. Anchor of "THE STORY," Martha MacCallum. We call him Scrooge McDuck because he's an expert on money and hates wearing pants. Host of "KUDLOW" on Fox Business and former director of the National Economic Council, Larry Kudlow. The only thing she does by the book is stealing from libraries. Fox News Contributor Kat Timpf. And if Will Smith's slapped him, he'd be getting his Oscar posthumously. My massive psychic and the NWA World Television Champion, Tyrus. Oh, Martha, Martha, Martha, Martha, what is going on with this administration? Should we be worried? Like I feel like they -- I feel like the Ukraine -- you - though, Ukraine, Ukraine wants this to end. But like -- but Biden is just making it last longer by stupidity, or is that just me?

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: That's just you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK. That's my feeling.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: You know, I mean, I think that -- I think that Zelenskyy would love for this to end, although every time they talk about negotiations, they seem to be at absolute opposite sides of the fence. With regard to the president and the things that he says, I think, honestly, he would be better off not walking it back at all and just letting it lie.

utterances.speaker: LARRY KUDLOW, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I mean, you know, no matter what you think of President Trump versus President Biden, you know that President Trump would never have walked back and comment like that. We remember the tweets that he said about the North Korean leader. But I also think that the smarter way to go with this kind of language is more along the lines of what we heard from President Reagan in terms of empowering the people of Russia, and encouraging them to potentially make different choices in the future about their world and about the kind of world that they want to live in. Then it's a dig at Putin is sort of saying we recognize the fact that many of the people who live in your country are probably against this war, and are probably against you in what you're doing without calling for regime change. It also reminded me of President Obama who told us time and time again, that Assad's days were numbered.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: And that he must go. And all across the country, the feeling was, well, this guy, there's no way he's going to last.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: His days are numbered. But guess what? He's still there. So, those things have a way of sticking around. And you have to be decisive. And if you're going to say something, like he said the other day, you just have to stick by it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Larry, what do you make of that saying regime change? I mean, that -- is that a good thing or a bad thing?

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: You know, Biden, who is totally bewildered. He can't say anything right. Yet our troops going into Ukraine. He won't give Zelenskyy the weapons. He's cognitively disabled. It's awful story. He's weak. He's intimidated by Putin. But he said the only good sentence of his entire presidency, OK? Which had a Reagan feel to it. I'll probably be criticized for this. Nobody agrees with me. And he said it. He said it. You know, I mean, Reagan used to say they when -- they say we win, they lose. Reagan used to say evil. Biden never attacks Putin directly. He never knocks him in the nose like he should. He has called him a war criminal. It was like pulling teeth to get out of it. It was a Fox reporter that got it out of it. He should call him a crook and corrupt because he has $700 million yacht sitting off the coast --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't get jealous, Larry.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: I don't. So, the, you know, Putin robbed the Russian working folks for the last three decades. But Martha's right in some sense. Biden said it, he took a whack at them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Stick with it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: I mean, the people that jumped on Biden the fastest were the people in his own administration.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Which is absolutely pathetic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who is that by the way? Who is -- who is the person that's doing the jumping? We're trying to figure that out in The Five. We don't know who it is.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, ostensibly, it was Antony Blinken. I don't know who started it, but it was Blinken, his secretary of state. I mean, Biden -- look, he took one whack at him. It's the only decent thing Biden said in a year or 14 months. Let it stand. Don't walk it back. Let it stand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Kat, given my many years of foreign policy experience going back to the 80s. I would disagree with Mr. Kudlow and saying that if you want to engage in negotiation, you don't demonize the other side. What side do you take? And remember, you work for me.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I do, which is actually OK. So, for Biden, he's not a guy -- that wasn't in like the prepared speech.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I just don't think he's a guy who should be riffing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I just think he shouldn't be riffing. And going back to my job, I think it's the difference between he was just saying, oh, hey, I was just saying how I feel but it's because of who you are that it was such a big deal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: So, if I see someone on Twitter who's like, oh, Kat is so annoying, like get rid of a replace. I think she should be replaced. I'm not going to think about it too much. If I heard you say that, that would be a little more concerning to me. Because you could actually do something about that. Just like Biden can actually do something about that. So, that's why -- that's why it matters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't check your voicemail.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Can I -- Can I just say one thing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Reagan pounded the evil empire, and its dictators and its Politburo czars, and then -- and then not only wound up making a deal that was to his advantage, you wouldn't give up SDI, remember that? And then the Soviet Union fell. Another words, sometimes you got to whack them a bunch of times to show that you at least have some manhood. Biden's problem is he hasn't had any manhood in this whole thing. And he should be calling Putin a war criminal and a crook on a daily basis. And you might be surprised either this -- either the Russians overthrow them or like take a poll. Do you think -- how many Americans you think agree with Lindsey Graham when he first came out and said Putin should be assassinated? How many? 92 percent, 98 percent, 99 percent. In other words, Biden was on something. His trouble is as Martha said, he should have stuck by it for heaven's sake and soften those guys up.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: The Kremlin said they thought it was alarming what he said.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. Alarming.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: -- alarming, what's going on Mariupol is alarming.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.sentences: this statement is not alarm -- how dare they say that -- I mean, it's --

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: I love it when you talk like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Last words to you, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I don't know what speech you guys are watching but I guess a lot of speech writers in the pandemic was the biggest class of workers that disappeared I guess. He was talking about points of light and how it was going to be a beautiful thing democracy and then my god man, man, he has to go -- there was nothing connected to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Not even a little bit. Whenever he talks, you get about two minutes of cognitive speech and then --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: My God man, and then I'm taking crazy pills or I'm going demand like him. He didn't walk back the regime change. He said policy change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: He wanted to change the voting rights in Russia. He had no clue about what he said. He said policy.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: He forgot regime.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Regime policy. I get them confused all the time. Tomato, tomato. We in trouble. There's no strong statements from him. All he does is ring dinner bells and enable the other side. And if I was in Taiwan right now, I would start packing up stuff because he just fires everybody up. They're literally on the phone going, you know (INAUDIBLE) did you hear what he just said? Do it. He's empowering the wrong side and makes us look horrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, wait until we get to this next segment. Oh, you're going to love this. Up next Chris Rock gets hit with an open hand. But was it real or was it planned? Of course it was real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Ah, there you are. Will Smith in Oscar disgrace because he left his fresh prints on Chris Rock's face. Or is Chris Rock a hater? Because he made a joke about Jada. And was three hours of Oscars crap saved or ruined by Will Smith slap? I speak of course of Smith who slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars over a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith who suffers from alopecia. Once again minorities were hit hardest. Now I don't remember when the slap happened. So let's just watch all 3-1/2 hours now. And I'm sure it'll pop up eventually.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS ROCK, AMERICAN COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Jada, I love you. G.I. Jane 2. Can't wait to see it. All right? (INAUDIBLE) that was a nice one. OK. I'm out here. Uh- oh. Richard. Oh wow. Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: At first that may have felt like it was staged but then Smith had some words for Rock after he sat back down.

utterances.speaker: ROCK
utterances.sentences: Wow. Will Smith just smack the (BLEEP) out of me.

utterances.speaker: WILL SMITH, AMERICAN ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Keep my wife's name out your (BLEEP) mouth.

utterances.speaker: ROCK
utterances.sentences: Wow, dude.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ROCK
utterances.sentences: It was a G.I. Jane joke.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Keep my wife's name out your (BLEEP) mouth.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I'm going to. OK? Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He was going to say something. I want to know what that is. Smith returned to the stage later to accept this award for Best Actor and apologize for the incident but didn't mention Rock.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: In this business, you got to be able to have people disrespecting you. And you got to smile and you got pretend like that's OK. I want to apologize to the academy. I want to apologize to my -- all my fellow nominees.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- apologize. It was an awesome moment. Anyway, now most of the reaction to the whole thing has been all over the place. But the dumbest take came from CNN analyst Asha Rangappa who tweeted, so did like anyone walk out after that happened? Or are we getting an independent psychological case study on how Trump got normalized? Yes. It was Trump's fault. Of course, expecting Hollywood to walk out over injustice. They make half their money from China. So rich black man smacks another rich black man at the dumbest event on television. So the only possible cause is white people, that's like blaming a hockey brawl on Barack Obama. Except in that case it would be true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: An idiot would say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: An idiot would say. All right. You have some strong feelings about this, Tyrus. Take it away.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Unfortunately, man, this is what happens when you're in a bad relationship. This is -- this is what this is. The -- Chris Rock is a comedian. He made a joke. He started with I love you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And he made a G.I. Jane joke. Not the worst thing ever to be said to anybody that you're a -- you're a badass woman who kicked ass and all men's military movie by yourself. Jada has always had short hair. And we know about her issue, but it was the laugh. Will Smith laughed at the joke. Everyone see him laugh at the joke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: She did not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: She made the face. And then when the camera goes back to Chris where he is going like that. That's the exchange. And that's when the husband who should have been like, it was just a joke, dear. He had to prove to her because that's how bad their relationship was. He goes up he smacks Chris and in my opinion he threw away everything that he stood for in that moment. This brother was one of the -- he was one of the brothers that -- he did a different. He wrapped without cussing. He did everything the right way. He was -- we had Bill Cosby. We know how that ended. He was the one guy who -- his criticism was always, he was soft. He was this, he was that. But he was the guy who did it right. He was the guy who tell you something like, hey, be like him. He did this way. He did it that way. In one moment, he was no different if he was going to be in NWA or any of the controversial groups back in the day, they used to fight against. All because -- it had nothing to do Chris Rock. It had nothing to do anything to do with him and Jada, and their relationship. And I mean, the turntable thing which he talked about. Basically being with the dude in the house and all that stuff. That stuff weighs on you. And when you have a bad relationship, that's what happens. You don't have to be in the academy wars to see it. We've seen at restaurants, bars, all kinds of places where a guy and his wife or his girl will be there, they had a bad relationship. Some guy says something like, you know, what are you going to do about it? See? I told you want a man or I'll show you and then walks over and hits the guy because that's their thing. So, they need counseling. And while the woke were just stuck, weren't they?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: They didn't know what to do. A straight black man and another straight black man one slap them. And they were like -- because to them it doesn't matter about violence if it doesn't affect them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: It's about the words. Now if Chris would have been gay and will slapped him. Boy. They'd be asking for the Academy Award back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: They'd be protesting but it's funny when he has not affected you, you really don't care about violence. Me personally, I think we'll should be -- should give the academy one back. He's disgraced himself. He disgraced everything he stood for. And Chris didn't deserve that. Not to mention the message. Next time a comedian says something you don't like and you're just going to walk up and hit him and say, well, He disrespected me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Kat, where do you stand on this? I'm sure that you are -- you wish that he had hit him harder.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I just -- I think it's awful. I can't even believe there's a debate over whether it was OK or not for someone to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are you against debate?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Just for someone to hit? No, I'm not. That's the entire point. For someone to hit a comic. That just the fact that that's acceptable to someone be on his side. Comedians are supposed to push boundaries, they're going to mess up sometimes. And I get it. I know it's I was diagnosed with alopecia when I was 27. I lost a severe amount of hair. Thankfully, I've been able to do things where a lot of it's grown back and it's better now. I cried a lot over. I know how devastating that can be even though I never lost all of mine. And it's better. It doesn't matter what the subject of the joke is. It doesn't matter at all. For people say oh, you can hit somebody, that's going to destroy it -- like that's what happens when you have all these people saying for so long words or violence, words or violence? Apparently people are taking it literally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Larry? Thoughts?

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: I don't know. This whole thing kind of baffles me. It's not exactly my cup of tea. I was really interested in what Tyrus said.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: I mean, I don't know anything about that. So she -- basically, he was laughing at the joke. But the wife --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: If we -- if we -- we're not -- we can't go back and put it in so much. He didn't laugh. He did this.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.utterance: Absolutely. I thought that was Brad Pitt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I know. I get that a lot. I look younger. But maybe that's a question only the pope can answer. The funny part, watching the media proclaim how forceful Joe had been in his regime change talk only to watch it get walked back like an escaped prisoner being returned to his cell.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: What a powerful speech that we just heard from President Biden there.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The speech was really, really well done and it touched on several strategic points.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That line there at the end directly to Putin, I think is the standout line from that entire speech, Wolf.

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: Yes. He made it clear, he wants Putin gone.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Certainly critical, certainly the message that he wanted to deliver here tonight. But that call at the end in terms of President Putin, that was something, no question about it.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.utterance: Obviously, those words this man cannot remain in power. Very, verystrong words.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. So strong. In fact, it had to be erased in a panic. A Biden aide said the president's point was that Putin cannot be allowed to exercise power over his neighbors on the region. He was not discussing Putin's power in Russia or regime change. Sorry. So (INAUDIBLE) forgot to say all of that. Now, it's bad enough, this administration is telling us what we can and can't say. Now they're telling us what we did and we didn't hear. Here's Joe trying to walk back his own words.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I want to make it clear, I wasn't then nor am I now, particularly the policy change. I was expressing more outrage that I feel I make no apologies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. But that came after something else. He said that was kind of pointless.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: You're in the midst of a fight between democracies and oligarchs? Who's going to prevail? Or democracy is going to prevail on a -- and the values we share? Or autocracies going to prevail? And that's really what's at stake. So, what you're doing is consequential, really consequential.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. How does this matter to the rest of the world? It only matters to us and it doesn't shorten the war. I'd only suggest that the war has a bigger mission for us, like it means more to us than it does to them. But does it? If only someone had warned him about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The invasion was a clear violation of international law. Don't start talking about protecting liberal democracies because places like China and Russia, they don't draw that line. It's not that important to them.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But they do understand violation of international law. You can't get around that statement.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who is that sexy beast? Someone should give that guy a late night show. But there were other gaffes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Sir, deterrence didn't work. What makes you think Vladimir Putin will alter course, based on the action you've taken today?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Let's get something straight. Do you remember if you covered me from the very beginning, I did not say that, in fact, the sanctions would deter him? Sanctions never deter. You keep talking about that. Sanctions never deter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, then what's their point? Are sanctions, like aroma therapy, where we just pretended works, but it just stinks up the place. And then there's this.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Ukrainian people have a lot of backbone, people have a lot of guts. And I'm sure you're observing it. And I don't mean just a military. And you're going to see when you're there. And you -- some of you have been there. You're going to see -- you're going to see women, young people standing the middle of -- in front of a damn tankjust saying, I'm not leaving. I'm holding my ground.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, you're going to see me, you're going to see when you're there. Biden puts his foot in his mouth more than a marooned cannibal. Now, maybe no one takes what Joe says seriously, maybe the world leaders see our president like Forrest Gump. They laugh and take advantage of them. But this old dog leaves so many messes on the carpet. If only there was a product that could take care of that once and for all.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I am so sick of cleaning up these messes. There's got to be a better way.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Well, then we've got a scoop for you. Introducing the White House pooper-scooper for when the president makes a mess of things. Perfect for when your boss is talking (BLEEP)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: For god's sake this man cannot remain power.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Or engaged in pissing contests.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: To clarify on chemical weapons, could if chemical weapons were used in Ukraine, would that trigger a military response from NATO?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: It would trigger response in kind.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It even works on verbal diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: Talking about the significance of the passage of time. Right? The significance of the passage of time. So, when you think about it, there is great significance to the passage of time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Eighty-one million people can't be wrong. Order yours today. Shipping may take 12 to 14 months due to supply chain issues.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Wearing mask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, the White House saw this trip to Brussels as a way to boost the precedence sagging numbers. So, you had all these photo ops eating pizza with troops, holding a refugee child, thank God there was no hair sniffing. And meeting with other so-called world leaders. But really if you wanted to enhance his status, he's just should have stayed home and dated Pete Davidson. It's sad, Joe's been in politics for over five decades, six if you count his first year as president. He was a V.P. for eight, been to a lot of countries, met all the players and of course knows Ukraine, like the back of Hunter's laptop. But in politics the longer you're in it the dumber and more detached you become. It's the only profession where experience counts against you. And the higher the stakes the more Biden screws up. Look, we know Putin violated international law and follows it with bomb and the crap out of Ukraine. So why help him at home by indulging his fears? It's just like telling Jesse Watters he's losing his hair. It only makes him angrier.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guests. In the interest of time, her bio list of people she hasn't interviewed. Anchor of "THE STORY," Martha MacCallum. We call him Scrooge McDuck because he's an expert on money and hates wearing pants. Host of "KUDLOW" on Fox Business and former director of the National Economic Council, Larry Kudlow. The only thing she does by the book is stealing from libraries. Fox News Contributor Kat Timpf. And if Will Smith's slapped him, he'd be getting his Oscar posthumously. My massive psychic and the NWA World Television Champion, Tyrus. Oh, Martha, Martha, Martha, Martha, what is going on with this administration? Should we be worried? Like I feel like they -- I feel like the Ukraine -- you - though, Ukraine, Ukraine wants this to end. But like -- but Biden is just making it last longer by stupidity, or is that just me?

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: That's just you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. That's my feeling.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: You know, I mean, I think that -- I think that Zelenskyy would love for this to end, although every time they talk about negotiations, they seem to be at absolute opposite sides of the fence. With regard to the president and the things that he says, I think, honestly, he would be better off not walking it back at all and just letting it lie.

utterances.speaker: LARRY KUDLOW, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: I mean, you know, no matter what you think of President Trump versus President Biden, you know that President Trump would never have walked back and comment like that. We remember the tweets that he said about the North Korean leader. But I also think that the smarter way to go with this kind of language is more along the lines of what we heard from President Reagan in terms of empowering the people of Russia, and encouraging them to potentially make different choices in the future about their world and about the kind of world that they want to live in. Then it's a dig at Putin is sort of saying we recognize the fact that many of the people who live in your country are probably against this war, and are probably against you in what you're doing without calling for regime change. It also reminded me of President Obama who told us time and time again, that Assad's days were numbered.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: And that he must go. And all across the country, the feeling was, well, this guy, there's no way he's going to last.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: His days are numbered. But guess what? He's still there. So, those things have a way of sticking around. And you have to be decisive. And if you're going to say something, like he said the other day, you just have to stick by it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Larry, what do you make of that saying regime change? I mean, that -- is that a good thing or a bad thing?

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: You know, Biden, who is totally bewildered. He can't say anything right. Yet our troops going into Ukraine. He won't give Zelenskyy the weapons. He's cognitively disabled. It's awful story. He's weak. He's intimidated by Putin. But he said the only good sentence of his entire presidency, OK? Which had a Reagan feel to it. I'll probably be criticized for this. Nobody agrees with me. And he said it. He said it. You know, I mean, Reagan used to say they when -- they say we win, they lose. Reagan used to say evil. Biden never attacks Putin directly. He never knocks him in the nose like he should. He has called him a war criminal. It was like pulling teeth to get out of it. It was a Fox reporter that got it out of it. He should call him a crook and corrupt because he has $700 million yacht sitting off the coast --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't get jealous, Larry.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: I don't. So, the, you know, Putin robbed the Russian working folks for the last three decades. But Martha's right in some sense. Biden said it, he took a whack at them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Stick with it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: I mean, the people that jumped on Biden the fastest were the people in his own administration.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Which is absolutely pathetic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who is that by the way? Who is -- who is the person that's doing the jumping? We're trying to figure that out in The Five. We don't know who it is.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, ostensibly, it was Antony Blinken. I don't know who started it, but it was Blinken, his secretary of state. I mean, Biden -- look, he took one whack at him. It's the only decent thing Biden said in a year or 14 months. Let it stand. Don't walk it back. Let it stand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Kat, given my many years of foreign policy experience going back to the 80s. I would disagree with Mr. Kudlow and saying that if you want to engage in negotiation, you don't demonize the other side. What side do you take? And remember, you work for me.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I do, which is actually OK. So, for Biden, he's not a guy -- that wasn't in like the prepared speech.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I just don't think he's a guy who should be riffing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I just think he shouldn't be riffing. And going back to my job, I think it's the difference between he was just saying, oh, hey, I was just saying how I feel but it's because of who you are that it was such a big deal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So, if I see someone on Twitter who's like, oh, Kat is so annoying, like get rid of a replace. I think she should be replaced. I'm not going to think about it too much. If I heard you say that, that would be a little more concerning to me. Because you could actually do something about that. Just like Biden can actually do something about that. So, that's why -- that's why it matters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't check your voicemail.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Can I -- Can I just say one thing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Reagan pounded the evil empire, and its dictators and its Politburo czars, and then -- and then not only wound up making a deal that was to his advantage, you wouldn't give up SDI, remember that? And then the Soviet Union fell. Another words, sometimes you got to whack them a bunch of times to show that you at least have some manhood. Biden's problem is he hasn't had any manhood in this whole thing. And he should be calling Putin a war criminal and a crook on a daily basis. And you might be surprised either this -- either the Russians overthrow them or like take a poll. Do you think -- how many Americans you think agree with Lindsey Graham when he first came out and said Putin should be assassinated? How many? 92 percent, 98 percent, 99 percent. In other words, Biden was on something. His trouble is as Martha said, he should have stuck by it for heaven's sake and soften those guys up.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: The Kremlin said they thought it was alarming what he said.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Yes. Alarming.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: -- alarming, what's going on Mariupol is alarming.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: this statement is not alarm -- how dare they say that -- I mean, it's --

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: I love it when you talk like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Last words to you, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I don't know what speech you guys are watching but I guess a lot of speech writers in the pandemic was the biggest class of workers that disappeared I guess. He was talking about points of light and how it was going to be a beautiful thing democracy and then my god man, man, he has to go -- there was nothing connected to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Not even a little bit. Whenever he talks, you get about two minutes of cognitive speech and then --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: My God man, and then I'm taking crazy pills or I'm going demand like him. He didn't walk back the regime change. He said policy change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: He wanted to change the voting rights in Russia. He had no clue about what he said. He said policy.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: He forgot regime.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Regime policy. I get them confused all the time. Tomato, tomato. We in trouble. There's no strong statements from him. All he does is ring dinner bells and enable the other side. And if I was in Taiwan right now, I would start packing up stuff because he just fires everybody up. They're literally on the phone going, you know (INAUDIBLE) did you hear what he just said? Do it. He's empowering the wrong side and makes us look horrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, wait until we get to this next segment. Oh, you're going to love this. Up next Chris Rock gets hit with an open hand. But was it real or was it planned? Of course it was real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ah, there you are. Will Smith in Oscar disgrace because he left his fresh prints on Chris Rock's face. Or is Chris Rock a hater? Because he made a joke about Jada. And was three hours of Oscars crap saved or ruined by Will Smith slap? I speak of course of Smith who slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars over a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith who suffers from alopecia. Once again minorities were hit hardest. Now I don't remember when the slap happened. So let's just watch all 3-1/2 hours now. And I'm sure it'll pop up eventually.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS ROCK, AMERICAN COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: Jada, I love you. G.I. Jane 2. Can't wait to see it. All right? (INAUDIBLE) that was a nice one. OK. I'm out here. Uh- oh. Richard. Oh wow. Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: At first that may have felt like it was staged but then Smith had some words for Rock after he sat back down.

utterances.speaker: ROCK
utterances.utterance: Wow. Will Smith just smack the (BLEEP) out of me.

utterances.speaker: WILL SMITH, AMERICAN ACTOR
utterances.utterance: Keep my wife's name out your (BLEEP) mouth.

utterances.speaker: ROCK
utterances.utterance: Wow, dude.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ROCK
utterances.utterance: It was a G.I. Jane joke.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Keep my wife's name out your (BLEEP) mouth.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I'm going to. OK? Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He was going to say something. I want to know what that is. Smith returned to the stage later to accept this award for Best Actor and apologize for the incident but didn't mention Rock.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: In this business, you got to be able to have people disrespecting you. And you got to smile and you got pretend like that's OK. I want to apologize to the academy. I want to apologize to my -- all my fellow nominees.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- apologize. It was an awesome moment. Anyway, now most of the reaction to the whole thing has been all over the place. But the dumbest take came from CNN analyst Asha Rangappa who tweeted, so did like anyone walk out after that happened? Or are we getting an independent psychological case study on how Trump got normalized? Yes. It was Trump's fault. Of course, expecting Hollywood to walk out over injustice. They make half their money from China. So rich black man smacks another rich black man at the dumbest event on television. So the only possible cause is white people, that's like blaming a hockey brawl on Barack Obama. Except in that case it would be true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: An idiot would say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: An idiot would say. All right. You have some strong feelings about this, Tyrus. Take it away.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Unfortunately, man, this is what happens when you're in a bad relationship. This is -- this is what this is. The -- Chris Rock is a comedian. He made a joke. He started with I love you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: And he made a G.I. Jane joke. Not the worst thing ever to be said to anybody that you're a -- you're a badass woman who kicked ass and all men's military movie by yourself. Jada has always had short hair. And we know about her issue, but it was the laugh. Will Smith laughed at the joke. Everyone see him laugh at the joke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: She did not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: She made the face. And then when the camera goes back to Chris where he is going like that. That's the exchange. And that's when the husband who should have been like, it was just a joke, dear. He had to prove to her because that's how bad their relationship was. He goes up he smacks Chris and in my opinion he threw away everything that he stood for in that moment. This brother was one of the -- he was one of the brothers that -- he did a different. He wrapped without cussing. He did everything the right way. He was -- we had Bill Cosby. We know how that ended. He was the one guy who -- his criticism was always, he was soft. He was this, he was that. But he was the guy who did it right. He was the guy who tell you something like, hey, be like him. He did this way. He did it that way. In one moment, he was no different if he was going to be in NWA or any of the controversial groups back in the day, they used to fight against. All because -- it had nothing to do Chris Rock. It had nothing to do anything to do with him and Jada, and their relationship. And I mean, the turntable thing which he talked about. Basically being with the dude in the house and all that stuff. That stuff weighs on you. And when you have a bad relationship, that's what happens. You don't have to be in the academy wars to see it. We've seen at restaurants, bars, all kinds of places where a guy and his wife or his girl will be there, they had a bad relationship. Some guy says something like, you know, what are you going to do about it? See? I told you want a man or I'll show you and then walks over and hits the guy because that's their thing. So, they need counseling. And while the woke were just stuck, weren't they?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: They didn't know what to do. A straight black man and another straight black man one slap them. And they were like -- because to them it doesn't matter about violence if it doesn't affect them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: It's about the words. Now if Chris would have been gay and will slapped him. Boy. They'd be asking for the Academy Award back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: They'd be protesting but it's funny when he has not affected you, you really don't care about violence. Me personally, I think we'll should be -- should give the academy one back. He's disgraced himself. He disgraced everything he stood for. And Chris didn't deserve that. Not to mention the message. Next time a comedian says something you don't like and you're just going to walk up and hit him and say, well, He disrespected me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Kat, where do you stand on this? I'm sure that you are -- you wish that he had hit him harder.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I just -- I think it's awful. I can't even believe there's a debate over whether it was OK or not for someone to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are you against debate?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Just for someone to hit? No, I'm not. That's the entire point. For someone to hit a comic. That just the fact that that's acceptable to someone be on his side. Comedians are supposed to push boundaries, they're going to mess up sometimes. And I get it. I know it's I was diagnosed with alopecia when I was 27. I lost a severe amount of hair. Thankfully, I've been able to do things where a lot of it's grown back and it's better now. I cried a lot over. I know how devastating that can be even though I never lost all of mine. And it's better. It doesn't matter what the subject of the joke is. It doesn't matter at all. For people say oh, you can hit somebody, that's going to destroy it -- like that's what happens when you have all these people saying for so long words or violence, words or violence? Apparently people are taking it literally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Larry? Thoughts?

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: I don't know. This whole thing kind of baffles me. It's not exactly my cup of tea. I was really interested in what Tyrus said.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: I mean, I don't know anything about that. So she -- basically, he was laughing at the joke. But the wife --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: If we -- if we -- we're not -- we can't go back and put it in so much. He didn't laugh. He did this.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Like that kind of laugh. And then --

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: So, she turn -- right. She turns to him and said defend me (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Look. Watch his face. He does the head back. I'm telling you as a brother. We -- we're emotional with our laughing, that stereotype is true. And when I'm like, haha --

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: I just think --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.utterance: Oh, damn.

utterances.speaker: KUDLOW
utterances.utterance: All these words, nobody watches this stuff. Anyways, it was the worst ratings, I think in their history and they're trying to ruin our culture. So, I actually care that much what happened. But it's all very interesting what you did say and I'll respect that and leave it --

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) remember when he went up and grabbed the award away --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was the Grammy's, right?

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: At the Grammy's, right. So that sort of broke that wall. And now you're allowed to I guess go up and react to whatever you want to react to. I thought the joke was dumb. It wasn't funny, first of all. And I -- and it was personal. So, it's like excluding everyone else who's watching and like what's going on and he said mean things about her before and, you know, so it's a classic Hollywood indulgence and I really don't care --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a high school cafeteria.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: What is going on between these two guys and why they have to bring it into -- and anyone else who won an award last night it's been completely overshadowed. No one's ever going to talk about it.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't have talked about it either.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. You know what's funny, though, Martha.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: No, we wouldn't, that's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nobody knows the movies.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: No, I'm sorry -- "Coda," I watched "Coda." It's the only one I watched. It's a nice movie. It's a sweet movie. It tells a good story. Is it a Best Picture?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I think this that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
